intro: Carex physodes, commonly known as the silver hair sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to moist, temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Carex physodes thrives in wet or damp soils, often found in marshes, swales, and along stream banks. Its dense growth habit makes it an effective plant for stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in wetland environments.
